intro: Draba lasiocarpa subsp. lasiocarpa, commonly known as the woolly rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It has basal leaves that are densely covered with white, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, high-altitude environments.
